docs.lead_paragraph: CAROL SILVERMAN paced the floor of the big, white, airy room, tweaking a posture here, walking her fingers down a spine there. Incense burned in the corner, and floor-to-ceiling windows framed the Hudson River, which glinted under a pale winter sky. ''Is your forehead smooth?'' she asked the students, arrayed on blue mat. ''Be your own therapist. Be present. Relax the neck.''
docs.abstract: Article on crop of yoga studios and yoga classes at gyms and health clubs that have sprung up in Westchester County, NY, in recent years; focuses on scene at Yoga Zone in Irvington, NY; photos (M)
docs.snippet: CAROL SILVERMAN paced the floor of the big, white, airy room, tweaking a posture here, walking her fingers down a spine there. Incense burned in the corner, and floor-to-ceiling windows framed the Hudson River, which glinted under a pale winter sky. ...

docs.lead_paragraph: ALISHA TUCKER is still in high school, yet recently she has helped a pregnant girl from Mount Vernon looking for prenatal care and another teenager who, fearing she had a sexually transmitted disease, was seeking medical testing. Alisha, a senior at Gorton High School in Yonkers, is a staff member of Teen-FYI, a new hot line set up to help teenagers deal with their problems. She and her co-workers have fielded calls about possible drug overdoses, injuries, pregnancy and sexuality.

headline.main: Confidential Hot Line Helps Troubled Youths

docs.abstract: Article on Teen-FYI, new confidential, anonymous telephone referral hotline manned by teens in Elmsford, NY; hotline was set up to help peers deal with problems they are often reluctant to discuss with parents or other adults; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Sex Education With Just One Lesson: No Sex'' (front page, Dec. 28) underscored that this country's expenditure of nearly $100 million a year on ''abstinence only'' programs is out of step with what Americans want.
docs.abstract: Planned Parenthood official Joan Malin letter on Dec 28 article holds 'abstinence only' sex education programs are out of step with what Americans want
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    ''Sex Education With Just One Lesson: No Sex'' (front page, Dec. 28) underscored that this country's expenditure of nearly $100 million a year on ''abstinence only'' programs is out of step with what Americans want.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Sex Education With Just One Lesson: No Sex'' (front page, Dec. 28): I am saddened by the misuse of state and federal money for religiously based moral propaganda.
docs.abstract: Xochitl Gonzalez letter on Dec 28 article deplores abstinence-only sex education
